issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: storm-core
components.description: Core storm daemons and APIs including trident

fields.description:
If we override some configuration parameters on the command line (using storm -c "param=value") when we launch the supervisor, workers don't inherit them.

{noformat}
> cat conf/storm.yaml
storm.zookeeper.servers:
     - "127.0.0.1"
nimbus.host: "127.0.0.1"
storm.zookeeper.root: "/stormtest"
storm.local.dir: "storm-local-main"

> python bin/storm -c "storm.local.dir=\"storm-local-custom\"" supervisor

> less logs/worker-6701.log
[...]

The worker tries to use the local directory defined in the configuration file (storm-local-main) instead of the local directory defined on the command line (storm-local-custom).

----

There is a similar problem with configuration file name. If we specify it on the command line, workers don't inherit it and search the default "storm.yaml" file in the classpath.

{noformat}
> cat conf/storm.yaml
storm.zookeeper.servers:
     - "127.0.0.1"
nimbus.host: "127.0.0.1"
storm.zookeeper.root: "/stormtest"
storm.local.dir: "storm-local-default"

> cat conf/storm-custom.yaml
storm.zookeeper.servers:
     - "127.0.0.1"
nimbus.host: "127.0.0.1"
storm.zookeeper.root: "/stormtest"
storm.local.dir: "storm-local-custom"

> python bin/storm --config storm-custom.yaml supervisor

> less logs/worker-6700.log
[...]

The worker tries to use the local directory "storm-local-default" defined in the configuration file "storm.yaml" instead of using the local directory "storm-local-custom" defined in the file "storm-custom.yaml" specified on the command line.
fields.summary: Workers don't inherit storm.conf.file/storm.options properties of the supervisor

comments.body:
GitHub user chrisz opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/incubator-storm/pull/252

    STORM-493: Workers inherit storm.conf.file/storm.options properties of their supervisor

    Without this fix, if we override some configuration parameters on the command line (using storm -c "param=value") when we launch the supervisor, workers don't inherit them.
    There is a similar problem with configuration file name. If we specify it on the command line, workers don't inherit it and search the default "storm.yaml" file in the classpath.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/chrisz/incubator-storm STORM-493

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/incubator-storm/pull/252.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #252
    
----
commit 4a7e634354df85f9ce52338a33e1e5fc1472f406
Author: Christophe CarrÃ© <christophe.carre@ymail.com>
Date:   2014-09-10T13:32:53Z

    STORM-493: Workers inherit storm.conf.file/storm.options properties of their supervisor

----

Github user Parth-Brahmbhatt commented on the pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/incubator-storm/pull/252#issuecomment-55157211
  
    Can you modify/add a test to validate this?

Github user chrisz commented on the pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/incubator-storm/pull/252#issuecomment-55294806
  
    I have some difficulties to have a working environment to execute unit tests of Storm: there are some timeout during tests (even before my fix) and I don't know what is bad with ma machine.
    
    I fixed unit tests related to my change.  I tried to add some tests but I am not comfortable with clojure...

Github user revans2 commented on the pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/252#issuecomment-56730938
  
    The test issues we have seen with timeouts seem to show up a lot with VMs, or slow servers.  I don't really know for sure what is happening there.  The code looks like it should work I am +1 for merging this in.
    
    @Parth-Brahmbhatt writing a test for this really does sound difficult because you would have to spawn a separate process and validate that the config is passed to the new process. If you still do want a test I'll relent, but otherwise I would like to check this in.
Thanks for the fix Christophe,  Keep up the good work.

Github user d2r commented on the pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/252#issuecomment-60832708
  
    It seems the JIRA, STORM-493, has been resolved, but this pull request is open and requires a merge.  Anybody know what happened with this pull request?

Github user clockfly commented on the pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/252#issuecomment-61639159
  
    +1

Github user clockfly commented on the pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/252#issuecomment-61639240
  
    merged.

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/252
